results.definition: an obstruction in a pipe or tube
examples: we had to call a plumber to clear out the blockage in the drainpipe

results.definition: the act of obstructing or deflecting someone's movements
a platform from which an auctioneer sells
examples: they put their paintings on the block

results.definition: a three-dimensional shape with six square or rectangular sides
prohibit the conversion or use of (assets)
an inability to remember or think of something you normally can do; often caused by emotional tension
examples: I knew his name perfectly well but I had a temporary block

results.definition: stop from happening or developing
be unable to remember
examples: You are blocking the name of your first wife!

results.definition: block passage through
a simple machine consisting of a wheel with a groove in which a rope can run to change the direction or point of application of a force applied to the rope
render unsuitable for passage
examples: block the way

results.definition: shut out from view or get in the way so as to hide from sight
examples: The thick curtain blocked the action on the stage

results.definition: interfere with or prevent the reception of signals
examples: block the signals emitted by this station

results.definition: obstruct
examples: Her arteries are blocked

results.definition: a metal casting containing the cylinders and cooling ducts of an engine
examples: the engine had to be replaced because the block was cracked

results.definition: a rectangular area in a city surrounded by streets and usually containing several buildings
examples: he lives in the next block

results.definition: impede the movement of (an opponent or a ball)
examples: block an attack

results.definition: hinder or prevent the progress or accomplishment of
examples: His brother blocked him at every turn

results.definition: a number or quantity of related things dealt with as a unit
examples: he reserved a large block of seats
he held a large block of the company's stock

results.definition: a solid piece of something (usually having flat rectangular sides)
examples: the pyramids were built with large stone blocks

results.definition: (computer science) a sector or group of sectors that function as the smallest data unit permitted
examples: since blocks are often defined as a single sector, the terms `block' and `sector' are sometimes used interchangeably

results.definition: housing in a large building that is divided into separate units
examples: there is a block of classrooms in the west wing

results.definition: interrupt the normal function of by means of anesthesia
examples: block a nerve
block a muscle

results.definition: run on a block system
examples: block trains

results.definition: shape by using a block
examples: block a garment

results.definition: shape into a block or blocks
examples: block the graphs so one can see the results clearly

results.definition: stamp or emboss a title or design on a book with a block
examples: block the book cover

results.definition: support, secure, or raise with a block
examples: block a plate for printing
block the wheels of a car
